availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patterson Tyler Jeffries (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Green County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Jane Pond Jeffries on March 11, 1841. Father of Cinthy A. Jeffries, William A. Jeffries, Mary C. Jeffries, Delila F. Jeffries, Louisa E. Jeffries, Nancy L. Jeffries, Benjamin K. Jeffries, Alvinza Jeffries, and Gaines Jeffries. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 103A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 616.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Metcalfe County, Lafayette District, p. 82A.
"Patterson Tyler Jeffries (1818-1874)," Find A Grave, Memorial 124094273, accessed February 6, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124094273.
